Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2008 01:34AM elsko wrote: thank you for your encouragement, you sound as a very strong individual, I am not and knowing medical information too much sometimes works against you, I don't know how I will ever get thtough pain, nausea, infections, anemia, bleeding, and more. I am frightened to death. Do you know where can I find the info about meeting with people face to face in my area? I appreciate any suggestions, including financial which is a nightmare as well, I have student insurance that does not cover much, but visiting family in Canada where I am going to stay for the treatment time. How long was your treatment all together? and how often? Where are you now with the treatment protocol? xo, Elena
Posts.Title: single and with breast cancer under 40? elsko thedudess

Posts.Content: elsko wrote: Hello, I am 37 yo, single and was just diagnosed with breast cancer, devastated, went back to medical school to pursue my dreams and was about to finish up and get an internship when suddenly was delivered the news, is there anyone else who is single and battleing breast cancer, I would really love to hear your experience, and how to find the strength to get thru treatment and move on, Yours, Elena Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: single and with breast cancer under 40? elsko thedudess

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2008 08:32AM elsko wrote: thank you so much for all your comments, i am afraid in my situation I will have to stay home throughout tx to avoind possible exposure, Can you please tell me chemo vs radiation? what to expect nad how long is each tx?? thank you for your replies, I am fascianted with each and all of you, you are my inspiration, Love, Elena
